New Records: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam in the sixth inning, tying the game and giving the Mets a 4-1 lead.
Jose Quintana pitched 5 innings, allowing only one unearned run, contributing to the Mets' victory.
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor's grand slam in the sixth inning was a turning point, propelling the Mets to a 4-1 lead.
Edwin Diaz struck out Kyle Schwarber to secure the 4-1 victory and advance the Mets to the NLCS.
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor expressed pride in the team's resilience and mentioned his family's presence at the game.
Carlos Mendoza delivered a speech before the champagne celebration, highlighting the team's efforts.
Howie Rose's final call compared to a movie script, encapsulating the team's improbable journey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pete Alonso's playful polar bear dance during celebrations added a unique touch to the postgame atmosphere.
